contentrichtext.text: {{for|World War II era class of submarines|Zwaardvisch class submarine}} {{no footnotes|date=January 2013}} {{DISPLAYTITLE:''Zwaardvis''-class submarine}} {|{{Infobox ship begin}} {{Infobox ship image |Ship image=[[File:SS793 Submarines1.jpg|300px]] |Ship caption=ROCS ''Hai Lung'' (SS-793 }} {{Infobox ship class overview |Builders=Rotterdam DD |Operators={{Navy|Netherlands}} <br /> {{Navy|ROC|name=ROC (Taiwan) Navy}} |Class before=[[Dolfijn class submarine]] |Class after=[[Walrus class submarine]] |Subclasses=[[Hai Lung class submarine]] |Built range= |In commission range= |Total ships building= |Total ships planned=4 |Total ships completed=4 |Total ships cancelled= |Total ships active=2 |Total ships laid up=2 |Total ships lost= |Total ships retired= |Total ships preserved= }} {{Infobox ship characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship type= |Ship displacement=2,408 tonnes surfaced<br>2,640 tonnes Submerged<br>2,660 t and 2,376 t for ''Hai Lung'' |Ship length=66.9 m |Ship beam=8.4 m |Ship draught=7.1 m<br>6.7 m in ''Hai Lung'' |Ship draft= |Ship propulsion=1 shaft from 3 × diesels, {{convert|4200|hp|abbr=on}}<br> 1 × Holec electric motor {{convert|5100|hp|abbr=on}} |Ship speed=13 Knots Surfaced <br>20 knots Submerged |Ship range={{convert|10000|nmi|km|-4|abbr=on}} at {{convert|9|kn|mph km/h|0}} |Ship endurance= |Ship test depth=220 m <br>300 m for ''Hai Lung'' |Ship complement= 67 (including 8 officers) |Ship sensors=radar type 1001<br> Sonar Elodone Octopus, type 20026 towed array, DUUX-5 |Ship EW= |Ship armament=6× 533 mm Tubes bow <br> 20 torpedoes (28 in Hai Lung) |Ship notes= }} |} The '''''Zwaardvis'' class submarine''' (Dutch: "Swordfish") is a conventional attack [[submarine]] that replaced the [[Dolfijn class submarine|''Dolfijn'' class]] in the [[Royal Netherlands Navy]]. ''Zwaardvis'' is based on the [[United States Navy|U.S. Navy]] [[Barbel class submarine|''Barbel'' class]] with the teardrop hull design. In September 1981 the [[Republic of China]] (Taiwan) ordered two modified ''Zwaardvis'' class submarines, the ''Chien Lung/Hai Lung'' class. In 1992 a repeat order for another 4 boats was turned down by the [[Netherlands]] Government because of pressure from the [[People's Republic of China]]. The two Dutch boats have been replaced by the [[Walrus class submarine|''Walrus'' class]]. The two decommissioned Dutch boats, ''[[HNLMS Zwaardvis]]'' and ''[[HNLMS Tijgerhaai]]'', were loaded onto a ship and transported to [[PSC-Naval Dockyard]], Lumut, Malaysia in anticipation of purchase by the [[Malaysian Navy]] in 1997. However, the Malaysian Navy declined the offer and chose the French [[Scorpène class submarine|''Scorpène'' class]] instead. The two boats are still in Lumut awaiting a buyer and possible refurbishment. ==Ships== *S806 ''Zwaardvis'' Commissioned: 18 August 1972 Decommissioned: 1994 *S807 ''Tijgerhaai'' Commissioned: 20 October 1972 Decommissioned: 1995 *793 ''Hai Lung'' Commissioned: 9 October 1987 *794 ''Hai Hu'' Commissioned: 9 April 1988 ==Notes== {{reflist}} ==References== * Conway's All the World's Fighting Ships 1947–1995 *[http://www.dutchsubmarines.com/classes/class_zwaardvis2.htm page from Dutch submarines] {{Barbel class submarines}} {{DISPLAYTITLE:''Zwaardvis'' class submarine}} [[Category:Submarine classes]] [[Category:Zwaardvis-class submarines| ]]
